column4: How do I open the File Manager as a root user?  I try to check the box on the share settings that enables "guest connections", and I can not check the box because it is greyed out.  Help?
How can I verify that samba is running?
How can I verify that samba is not corrupt?
I can not access my shares from my Win7 computer.  How should I start troubleshooting?  I have a good ping between the computers.
I need more information...  What kind of Linux machine is hosting the SAMBA shares?
I have.  They are def. shared and even allow users to modify file contents
Right-click one of your shared folders and open the sharing properties
OK, next, open a terminal and issue the following command:
both usernames and passwords are the same on both machines.
I will tackle this problem later.  I am sure that I messed up samba somehow by installing GADMIN Tools
I guess I'll just use a thumb drive for now!  DOH!
